Class NameMatcher<E extends AnnotatedEntity>

java.lang.Object

      uk.ac.ebi.mdk.tool.match.NameMatcher<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntityMatcher<E,Set<String>>
public class NameMatcher<E extends AnnotatedEntity>
extends AbstractMatcher<E,Set<String>>
implements EntityMatcher<E,Set<String>>

Class realises EntityMatcher using the names, abbreviations and synonyms of the annotated entities.

Compares the names, abbreviations and synonyms of two annotated entities. The names are normalised to lower case (Locale.ENGLISH) and trimmed of excess space. If any name/synonym matches then the metabolites are considered matches.

Author:
johnmay

matchMetric

public Boolean matchMetric(Set<String> queryMetric,
                           Set<String> subjectMetric)
Description copied from class: AbstractMatcher
Default metric matching uses the Object.equals() method of the query metric to determine weather the two calculated metrics are equals. You would normally want to override this default behaviour particularly when dealing with collections. If the calculated metric is a Collection then the AbstractMatcher.matchAny(java.util.Collection, java.util.Collection) and AbstractMatcher.matchAll(java.util.Collection, java.util.Collection) provide some default collection matching.

Please not this method is not null safe and parsing a null object as the queryMetric will throw a null pointer exception.

Specified by:
matchMetric in interface EntityMatcher<E extends AnnotatedEntity,Set<String>>
Overrides:
matchMetric in class AbstractMatcher<E extends AnnotatedEntity,Set<String>>
Parameters:
queryMetric - calculated query metric
subjectMetric - calculated subject metric
Returns:
whether the metrics match
